refnamediv.refpurpose: A validator that is applied to user input.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The validator objects are invoked when the element's control gets posted. the validator elements only make sense inside field or form types of controls. the validators are invoked in the order given, and the first one to fail stops the invocation chain, so that no later ones are attempted. furthermore the vc_is_valid member of the containing page class instance will be reset to false (0) to stop further processing. see also error-summary element and error-glyph attribute of field element.

refsect1.title: Attributes

formalpara.title: name = SqlName
formalpara.para: A page level unique name identifying a control.

formalpara.title: annotation
formalpara.para: A human readable comment.

formalpara.title: initial-enable = CalculateableValue
formalpara.para: Determines whether a control is initially visible. True by default. Could be data-bound to an SQL expression.

formalpara.title: enabled = CalculateableValue
formalpara.para: Determines whether a control is visible. True by default. Could be data-bound to an SQL expression.

formalpara.title: instantiate = CalculateableValue
formalpara.para: Determines whether a control instantiate its children. It is true by default. It could be data-bound to an SQL expression. Unlike most of calcucateable attributes, the value of this attribute for a control is calcluated before calling 'on-init' event handler of the control; other values are calculated before calling 'before-data-bind' event handler.

formalpara.title: control-udt = SqlName
formalpara.para: At run time every control is represented as an instance of some user-defined type (UDT). VSPX compiles selects the UDT to use depending on name of the XML element that represents the control and maybe some of its attributes. In some specific cases the application developer may instruct VSPX compiler to use some other UDT, e.g. an application-specific UDT that is derived from the preset one. If specified, the value of 'control-udt' attribute should be equal to the name of the desired target UDT.

formalpara.title: xsd-stub-xhtml
formalpara.para: This attribute is for internal use only. It has no effect if added to the source VSPX file.

formalpara.title: width
formalpara.para: Visible width of the control when it is displayed in WYSIWYG tools when the source VSPX text is edited. The value of this attribute will not be used when the resulting HTML is rendered.

formalpara.title: height
formalpara.para: Visible width of the control when it is displayed in WYSIWYG tools when the source VSPX text is edited. The value of this attribute will not be used when the resulting HTML is rendered.

formalpara.title: test
formalpara.para: The type of test to be performed, can be 'length', 'value', 'regexp' or 'sql'.

formalpara.title: min
formalpara.para: A lower limit in value and length tests

formalpara.title: max
formalpara.para: The upper limit for value and length tests

formalpara.title: regexp
formalpara.para: The REGEXP pattern to match field value

formalpara.title: expression
formalpara.para: A SQL expression for validation

formalpara.title: empty-allowed
formalpara.para: If specified as true (1) this will allow submitting an empty field

formalpara.title: message
formalpara.para: The error message to be associated to parent control when the test represented by this validator fails.

formalpara.title: runat
formalpara.para: Where to perform validation, at server side after posting, or at browser side when entering the values. Note that client side validators can be assigned only to input controls, hence client side form validators for inter-field integrity testing are not allowed.

refsect1.para: Client side validators will generate client side JavaScript.

formalpara.title: debug-srcfile
formalpara.para: URI of the source document where the tag comes from.

formalpara.title: debug-srcline
formalpara.para: Line number in the source document where the tag comes from.

formalpara.title: debug-log
formalpara.para: This defines what sort of data are saved to the debugging log.

example.title: Validation of text area input
example.para: The form contains a v:textarea control with v:validator assigned. When the OK button is pressed, data are posted back to the same URI so the page is instantiated again. If validator found a violation, the message is shown right after the text input. (The error reporting may be changed by using v:error-summary VSPX control and by adding 'error-glyph' attribute to the v:textarea.)
example.screen: <v:page name="validator__0" xmlns:v="http://http://example.com/vspx/"> <html> <head> <title>VSPX samples | v:validator</title> </head> <body> <v:form name="form1" type="simple" action="" method="POST"> <v:textarea name="ta1" default="enter your text here" value="--coalesce ({?'ta1'}, control.ufl_value)"> <v:validator test="length" min="0" max="50" message="The input length should not exceed 50 chars."/> </v:textarea> <v:button name="submit1" action="simple" value="OK"/> </v:form> </body> </html> </v:page>
